title: NumPy: Reshaping Arrays
story: Reshaping allows you to change the dimensions of an array without changing its data. This is crucial for matrix operations and data preprocessing.
instructions: Create a 1D array with values 1 to 12, then reshape it to a 3x4 matrix (3 rows, 4 columns). Print the reshaped array.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Create array and reshape
arr = np.arange(1, 13)
reshaped = arr.reshape(3, 4)
print(reshaped)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

arr = np.arange(1, 13)
reshaped = arr.reshape(3, 4)
print(reshaped)

tests.expectedBehavior: Print reshaped matrix with correct values

hints.text: Use np.arange(1, 13) to create numbers 1-12, then call .reshape(3, 4).
The total elements (12) must match rows × columns (3 × 4).
